intro: Galium pumilio, commonly known as dwarf white bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium pumilio thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
